faq.question: What resolution can I achieve from Midjourney PNGs?

faq.question: Can I upscale layered Photoshop TIFF files?

faq.question: Why use BMP for Photoshop artwork?
faq.answer: BMP provides uncompressed, lossless quality with universal Windows compatibility, ideal for Windows applications requiring maximum quality from Photoshop.

faq.question: Is BMP better than PNG for Photoshop?
faq.answer: Both provide lossless quality. BMP is more compatible with older Windows software, while PNG offers smaller file sizes and better web support.

faq.question: Will BMP files be very large?
faq.answer: Yes, BMP is uncompressed so files are larger than PNG. This ensures maximum quality but requires more storage space.

faq.question: Can Windows programs open BMP Photoshop files?
faq.answer: Yes! BMP is natively supported by all versions of Windows and virtually all Windows applications.

faq.question: Why use AVIF for Photoshop artwork?
faq.answer: AVIF provides superior compression compared to WebP and JPEG while maintaining excellent quality, perfect for modern web display of Photoshop artwork.

faq.question: Is AVIF better than WebP for Photoshop?
faq.answer: Yes! AVIF typically provides 50% smaller files than WebP while maintaining the same visual quality for Photoshop artwork.

faq.question: Which browsers support AVIF Photoshop files?
faq.answer: AVIF is supported by all modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge. Older browsers may need fallback formats.

faq.question: Should I use AVIF for all PS web artwork?
faq.answer: For modern web use, AVIF is excellent. For print or archival storage, consider lossless formats like PNG or TIFF instead.

faq.question: Does this work with Lightroom Classic and CC?

faq.question: Will I lose my Lightroom adjustments?

faq.question: Can I re-import enhanced RAW files into Lightroom?

faq.question: What RAW formats are supported?
